Welcome to the Jensen Lab

Our team of engineers and scientists tackle infectious diseases. We use robotics, genomics, and computation to accelerate microbiology and design new therapies.


News

  • October 2023: Our lab presents five posters and a talk at the BMES Annual Meeting in Seattle, WA.

  • September 2023: Our lab received an NIGMS Equipment Supplement to purchase a BioTek Cytation 10 automated confocal imaging plate reader.

  • August 2023: Deepthi, Ben, Noelle, Kurt, and Noah passed their qualifying exams and advanced to candidacy.

  • July 2023: Our lab received a START grant from Michigan Engineering to optimize riboflavin production in streptococci.

Deep Phenotyping Status

Our Deep Phenotyping system has completed 931,038 automated experiments since January 2020.

Department of Biomedical Engineering, University of Michigan
